---
title: "oidc_missing_client_secret.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file defines authentication settings for an application, specifically focusing on OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication. It sets up basic authentication requirements and configures an OIDC provider named "foo" with partial settings.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration block for authentication settings in the application.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets authentication as required for the application
- Configures session settings
- Defines authentication methods, specifically OIDC

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the application.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Set to `true`, making authentication mandatory |

### `authentication.session`
#### Description
Configures session-related settings for the authentication process.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the session domain to "http://localhost:8080"
- Disables secure sessions

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| domain | string | The domain for the session, set to "http://localhost:8080" |
| secure | boolean | Whether the session should be secure, set to `false` |

### `authentication.methods.oidc`
#### Description
Configures OpenID Connect (OIDC) as an authentication method.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables OIDC authentication
- Defines a provider named "foo" with partial configuration

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Whether OIDC authentication is enabled, set to `true` |
| providers | object | Configuration for OIDC providers |

### `authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo`
#### Description
Configures a specific OIDC provider named "foo".

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the client ID
- Specifies the redirect address
- Defines required scopes

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| client_id | string | The client ID for the OIDC provider, set to "client_id" |
| redirect_address | string | The redirect address after authentication, set to "http://localhost:8080" |
| scopes | array | An array of required scopes, containing "user:email" |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Whether authentication is mandatory |
| authentication.session.domain | string | "http://localhost:8080" | The domain for the session |
| authentication.session.secure | boolean | false | Whether the session should be secure |
| authentication.methods.oidc.enabled | boolean | true | Whether OIDC authentication is enabled |
| authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo.client_id | string | "client_id" | The client ID for the OIDC provider |
| authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo.redirect_address | string | "http://localhost:8080" | The redirect address after authentication |
| authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo.scopes | array | ["user:email"] | Required scopes for the OIDC provider |

## Notes
1. The filename "oidc_missing_client_secret.yml" suggests that this configuration is intentionally missing the client secret, which is a crucial part of OIDC authentication. This file might be used for testing scenarios where the absence of a client secret needs to be handled.
2. The session is configured with `secure: false`, which is typically not recommended for production environments. This setting might be used for local development or testing purposes.
3. The OIDC provider "foo" is only partially configured. In a complete configuration, additional settings like `issuer_url` or `discovery_url` would typically be present.
4. The configuration uses "http://localhost:8080" for both the session domain and the redirect address, indicating a local development or testing setup.
